body_html:
Fedora 26 comes with GCC 7, but CUDA 8 only supports gcc5 (and CUDA 9 supports gcc6).
I had installed CUDA 8 successfully some time ago, but forgotten the above requirement.

To install GCC 5 on Fedora follow these instructions (scroll down the page): https://jasonqsy.github.io/compile-tensorflow-with-gpu-support-on-fedora.html
The instructions are probably applicable for other distros or CUDA9 and gcc6 as well though I haven't tried it.

Then, when running .configure, remember to specify the location for gcc5.4. Doing that solved the above compilation errors for me.

It might be a good idea to add GCC Version to the issue template, or even check that the gcc path provided is compatible with the specified CUDA version when configuring the tensorflow installation.

body:
Fedora 26 comes with GCC 7, but CUDA 8 only supports gcc5 (and CUDA 9 supports gcc6).
I had installed CUDA 8 successfully some time ago, but forgotten the above requirement. 

To install GCC 5 on Fedora follow these instructions (scroll down the page): https://jasonqsy.github.io/compile-tensorflow-with-gpu-support-on-fedora.html
The instructions are probably applicable for other distros or CUDA9 and gcc6 as well though I haven't tried it.

Then, when running `.configure`, remember to specify the location for gcc5.4. Doing that solved the above compilation errors for me.

It might be a good idea to add GCC Version to the issue template, or even check that the gcc path provided is compatible with the specified CUDA version when configuring the tensorflow installation.
